99

Hopefully, you see that using sight alone instead of letting your patient self-report is not accurate.

 

Click the "Key Points" button below to review.

Using Sight Alone: Review Key Points

•

Avoid guessing a patient’s REAL choices.

•

REAL selections are the patient’s choices.  Each answer you report in your registration system should reflect what the patient says he or she is, not what you think the patient is, based on what you see.

•

Using sight alone leads to errors and does not give patients their right to choose their own categories.

•

Remember, errors in REAL data collection will lead to less accurate data for improving patient care and satisfaction.
